page.title: 01NW.SHERBORNE:GEN.DESCRIPTION
page.content: This area of land is all in{Dorset}but close to the Somerset border.It is quite{hilly}although not very high,the highest point is 162m above sea level. The hill tops join with one another along a line from North East to South West.They are connected by farm tracks. Nearly all of the area is {farmland},the steep slopes are mostly rough grazing and the rest either arable or grassland. There are a number of very{small villages} surrounding the block, but none in it. The only place in the block to have shops and several houses is in the south-east corner which contains the historic town of{Sherborne.}There are some fairly{small woodlands;}and a number of small{streams.}The streams all join the{River Yeo}just outside our block.
